groups.name: Account
groups.description:
The account endpoints can be used for everything regarding authentication, authorization,
and account management. This includes feedback functionality, favorites and statistics retrieval.
Users can only retrieve and modify their own data.

groups.name: Favorites
groups.description:
Users can add other users to their favorites. This resource represents a list of
all favorites for the given user.

operations.name: List Favorites
operations.description:
List all favorites of the given user. As with most other endpoints, users can only request their own
information.

first.description: Full URL for the first page of results

last.description: Full URL for the last page of results

prev.description: Full URL for the previous page of results

next.description: Full URL for the next page of results

from.description: Number of first entry for current page

to.description: Number of last entry for current page

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

operations.name: Show User
operations.description:
Show information about a given user. When requesting information about other users, only
the `userId`, `nickname`, `picture` and `is_favourite` attributes will be included in the response.
If the user is requesting his own information, the response will also contain
personal and ranking data. It will **not** include the `is_favourite` attribute in that case.

is_favourite.description: Boolean flag indicating whether this user is in the favorites list of the requesting user

authToken.description: API token used for all requests

pharmacy.description: Name of the pharmacy the user belongs to

rank.description: Rank on the global leader board

intermediateRank.description: Real rank of the user, ignoring duplicate ranks (i.e. two users with the same amount of games won will only count once instead of twice)

wonGamesForPremiumPoints.description: Amount of games won that are eligible for premium points (capped at 100)

maxPremiumPointsPerMonth.description: Maximum amount of premium points awarded per month for won games

incPremiumPointsPerWonStreak.description: Amount of points the user is awarded for every 10 wins

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

operations.name: Login User
operations.description:
Login a user using his credentials and retrieve the API token. The `DD-Credentials` header must contain the
base64-encoded username and password of the user, separated by a colon. The header should have the following
format: `base64(username):base64(password)`

authToken.description: API token used for all requests

pharmacy.description: Name of the pharmacy the user belongs to

rank.description: Rank on the global leader board

maxPremiumPointsPerMonth.description: Maximum amount of premium points awarded per month for won games

incPremiumPointsPerWonStreak.description: Amount of points the user is awarded for every 10 wins

operations.name: Check Nickname Availability
operations.description:
Check whether a given (base64-encoded) nickname is available. A 204 (`No Content`) response is
returned in case the nickname is still available. Otherwise a 409 (`Conflict`) response is returned.

groups.name: Achievements

operations.name: List Achievement Groups
operations.description:
List all available achievement groups.

### Filters

This endpoint has JSON-API filters enabled, and may use any of the following filters:

| Filter  | Values |
|----- | ----------- |
|`include` | `achievements` |

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Relationships to include in the response

sorting.description: Integer indicating the (ascending) sorting order. Multiple entries may have the same sorting order, in which case they should be sorted alphabetically

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

sorting.description: Integer indicating the (ascending) sorting order. Multiple entries may have the same sorting order, in which case they should be sorted alphabetically

operations.name: List Achievements
operations.description: List all available achievements.

points.description: Amount of premium points awarded for completing the achievement

goal.description: Numeric goal necessary to reach this achievement

sorting.description: Integer indicating the (ascending) sorting order. Multiple entries may have the same sorting order, in which case they should be sorted alphabetically

group_id.description: ID of the group the achievement belongs to

examples:
[
    {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Neu hier?",
        "slug": "first-game",
        "description": "Schlieen Sie Ihr erstes Spiel ab",
        "icon": null,
        "points": 10,
        "goal": 1,
        "sorting": 0,
        "group_id": 1
    },
    {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Gewonnen",
        "slug": "first-win",
        "description": "Gewinnen Sie Ihr erstes Spiel",
        "icon": null,
        "points": 15,
        "goal": 1,
        "sorting": 0,
        "group_id": 1
    }
]

operations.name: List User Achievements
operations.description:
List all achievements and their progress for the requesting user. Similar to
the request above, but it will also mark completed achievements and include
the current progress.

points.description: Amount of premium points awarded for completing the achievement

goal.description: Numeric goal necessary to reach this achievement

sorting.description: Integer indicating the (ascending) sorting order. Multiple entries may have the same sorting order, in which case they should be sorted alphabetically

progress.description: Current progress by the user towards the numeric goal

completed.description: Indicates whether the achievement has been completed by the user

group_id.description: ID of the group the achievement belongs to

examples:
[
    {
        "id": 3,
        "name": "Volltreffer!",
        "description": "Beantworten Sie in einer Kategorie alle 3 Fragen richtig",
        "icon": null,
        "points": 15,
        "goal": 3,
        "sorting": 0,
        "progress": 3,
        "completed": true,
        "group_id": 1
    },
    {
        "id": 56,
        "name": "Allergiefrei!",
        "description": "Geben Sie die richtige Antwort auf alle Fragen der Kategorie Allergien und empfindliche Haut",
        "icon": null,
        "points": 15,
        "goal": 5,
        "sorting": 0,
        "progress": 3,
        "completed": false,
        "group_id": 1
    }
]

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

groups.name: Quiz
groups.description:
The quiz endpoints can be used for starting and requesting quiz games and rounds.
A quiz (game) takes place between two users over 5 rounds with 3 questions each.
Users take turns choosing a category for the questions of a round. Prizes and rewards
can be won by winning games or completing challenges.

Users can also choose to abandon games, whereupon the opponent will receive the win and
the abandoning user will not get any points credited. Every 10 games won, a user will
receive bounty points that can be redeemed for prizes. Users can directly challenge
other users, or start a game against a random, available (i.e. also looking for a
random game) opponent.

groups.name: Categories
groups.description: Resource representing a list of all quiz categories.

operations.name: List Categories
operations.description: List all available quiz categories.

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.
Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

operations.name: Show Category
operations.description: Show details for a given category.

405.description: Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.
Method not allowed. Wrong HTTP method used to access this resource.

groups.name: Games
groups.description:
Resource representing a list of all quiz games the user is participating in.
A game can have one of 3 statuses:

| Code | Status | Description |
|----- | -----------| -----------|
|`0` | `Active` | Game that both users have participated in, i.e. at least 2 answers. |
|`1` | `Finished` | Game that was either abandoned or where all 5 rounds (10 answers) have been played |
|`2` | `New` | Game that was recently started, with 0 or 1 answers. |

operations.name: List games
operations.description:
List all games the user is participating in, optionally filtered by status. The 
`score` represents the number of correctly answered questions.

abandoned.description: ID of the user that abandoned the game, or -1 when the game has not been abandoned

idOtherUser.description: ID of the opponent. If 0, no opponent is set for this game

scoreMe.description: Total score for the requesting user

myTurn.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether it's the user's turn (1) or not (0) to create a new round. Will only be present for active and new games

first.description: Full URL for the first page of results

last.description: Full URL for the last page of results

prev.description: Full URL for the previous page of results

next.description: Full URL for the next page of results

from.description: Number of first entry for current page

to.description: Number of last entry for current page

operations.name: Create New Game
operations.description:
Create a new game between 2 users, one of them being the requesting user. If an
already active game between these 2 users is found, a `409` response is returned.

operations.name: Abandon Game
operations.description:
Abandon the given game. Upon abandoning, the opponent will receive the win,
and the requesting user will not have any of his points awarded.

operations.name: Create New Round
operations.description:
Create a new round for a given game. When creating a round, a category can be freely
chosen. Users take turns creating rounds, so a round can only be created when it's
the requesting user's turn (see `myTurn` attribute when requesting 
[game information](#users-games-entity-show)). If it's not the user's turn, a `403`
response will be returned.

categoryId.description: ID of the category for this round

is_correct.description: Indicates whether the given answer was correct. Null when no answer given

they are sealed and cannot be modified again.

operations.name: Get Random Game
operations.description:
Fetch or create a random game for the requesting user. If no opponent also looking
for a random game could be found, a new game will be created. Opponents looking
for random games in the future may then join this game. Only of these "opponent-less"
games may be active at any given time.

abandoned.description: ID of the user that abandoned the game, or -1 when the game has not been abandoned

idOtherUser.description: ID of the opponent. If 0, no opponent is set for this game

scoreMe.description: Total score for the requesting user

myTurn.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether it's the user's turn (1) or not (0) to create a new round
